title: Coffeemaker: Modeling Riemann sums part - d

content.question: The amount of coffee in the cup, in ounces, is modeled by B(t)=16-16e-0.4t. Using this model, find the rate at which the amount of coffee in the cup is changing when t=5.

frqParts.text: The amount of coffee in the cup, in ounces, is modeled by B(t)=16-16e-0.4t. Using this model, find the rate at which the amount of coffee in the cup is changing when t=5.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
